data.text: Waterproof Bottom Brackets for Long-distance Bike Touring

data.text: If you let water get to them they'll all rot. I doubt there's as much difference between the best and worst as the prices indicate. Spending time is a better investment than spending more money, mine comes out once a year and smothered in waterproof grease. It's a half hour job. Along with a mid price Shimano I do have an expensive IRD (Because it was the only one in the size I needed) comes with a ten yer warranty and the bearings are replaceable. We'll see which lasts the longest!
